name: Urban Sketchers Singapore: Volume 01 (Second Edition)
description: This second edition presents over 360 beautiful drawings that capture local moments, places and life. It documents the sketching escapades of this motley crew of artists and hobbyists, and reflects on urban context and city planning through their eyes. Explore the spice streets of Little India, the landmark Sultan Mosque and the last kampung of Lorong Buangkok, as you leaf through and fall in love with these places. First published with a partial grant from the Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA) of Singapore through its Architecture and Urban Design Excellence Promotion Programme, the substantial hardcover sold out within 9 months of it's release in October 2011. It was picked up by BookActually's imprint, Math Paper Press, for a second print run, and is now also available in two cover colours. You can also read a review of the original book, and compare it with the first edition, on Parka Blogs. ISBN: 978-981-08-9292-0 Format: Hardcover with thread-sewn binding Size: 150 x 230mm Pages: 300 Published: May 2013 Images courtesy of Math Paper Press.

name: Our Neighbourhoods
description:
This series is published by Epigram Books in collaboration with us, featuring the unique places that Singaporeans call home. The books are little time capsules of all that is quintessential in each locale. Marvel over the drawings of various fixtures of life in the housing estates and their vicinities, from the walk-up apartments in Tiong Bahru, the lovely Toa Payoh Town Park, to the Princess Theatre still standing in Bedok. JUST OUT! We ♥ Queenstown was released on Friday, 13 September, tying in with the Urban Sketchers Singapore at My Queenstown exhibition opening. The grand old dame of an estate is turning sixty and a fortnight of celebrations will set the stage for it's anniversary date on the 29th. Bedok is third in the line-up started by Toa Payoh, followed with Tiong Bahru, and Queenstown is up next. Local film auteur and director of "Old Places" Royston Tan said, of We ♥ Bedok: “Memory is the ultimate thing that makes a place come alive. I was a Bedok kid, and this book beautifully preserves the diversity and colour of Bedok!” You can also read a review of the series, on Parka Blogs. Format: Paperback with perfect-binding Size: 125 x 175mm Pages: 96 TITLES: We ♥ Toa Payoh The grand old swimming complex, lovely town park and iconic Lian Shan Shuang Lin Monastery are all lovingly captured in deft strokes of ink and colour, alongside places nestling in the nooks and crannies of the estate, such as the old-school Bugs Bunny barber and the buzzing bird-singing pavilion at Lorong 4. Published: Nov 2012 ISBN: 978-981-07-3623-1 We ♥ Tiong Bahru Old nostalgia and the excitingly new make for strange but symbiotic bedfellows in this neighbourhood. Sketches reveal the beauty of its many subjects, and juxtaposed the nostalgic places in the conservation areas with the newer cafes and residential buildings. Published: Feb 2013 ISBN: 978-981-07-3625-5

We ♥ Bedok While in the past this neighbourhood was known for its scrumptious seafood, Bedok now boasts of rojak and cheng tng known across the island. Sketchers help you imagine the thrills of songbirds, taking a dip at the swimming complex and jogging around Bedok Reservoir Park, where a fragment of a famous wall in Berlin sat proudly for awhile. Published: Apr 2013 ISBN: 987-981-07-5432-7
TITLES: We ♥ Queenstown Take a trip down memory lane and imagine the late Queenstown cinema and bowling alley in its heyday. Visit Stirling Road to view Singapore’s first HDB blocks and enjoy the unique personality of each HDB terrace house. Admire the religious harmony and architectural diversity of Queenstown’s churches, temples and mosques. To escape the heat, slip into the cool oasis of Queenstown Community Library, which remains in the middle of winding Margaret Drive. Published: Sep 2013 ISBN: 987-981-07-6601-6 Images courtesy of Teoh Yi Chie

name: Have Phone, Will Paint
description: Known for his bold and quirky style, Zhu Hong presents a new collection of drawings in his second book, Have Phone, Will Paint. Mostly based in Singapore, his smartphone drawings are refreshingly insightful in their portrayal of everyday scenes, whether they take place at the heart of an HDB neighbourhood, at the humble coffeeshop, or inside an MRT cabin. Published by BookActually's imprint, Math Paper Press, this book is the second released by the avid sketcher. ISBN: 978-981-07-2895-3 Format: Hardcover with thread-sewn binding Size: 225 x 157 x 16 mm Pages: 125 Published: August 2013 Images courtesy of Math Paper Press.

name: Thirty Days on the Camino
description: The Camino de Santiago is a popular pilgrimage route in Europe. Globetrotting artist Alvin Mark Tan walks 800km of the way over 30 days, and records his sights and experiences in his drawings. He hopes his story will inspire readers to go off the beaten track from time to time. The self-published title is distributed by BookActually's imprint, Math Paper Press, and is his first release. ISBN: 978-981-07-4757-2 Format: Hardcover with thread-sewn binding Size: 225 x 157 x 16 mm Pages: 100 Published: 2012 Images courtesy of Math Paper Press.
